trans-unit.source: Enables the Web programming model for a [!INCLUDE[indigo1](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)] service.

The WebHttpBehavior behavior, when used in conjunction with the <xref:System.ServiceModel.WebHttpBinding> binding, enables [!INCLUDE[indigo2](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)] to expose and access Web style services.
<xref:System.ServiceModel.Web.WebServiceHost> automatically adds this behavior to endpoints that use the <xref:System.ServiceModel.WebHttpBinding>.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Description.WebHttpBehavior"></xref> class.

Implements the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.IEndpointBehavior.AddBindingParameters%28System.ServiceModel.Description.ServiceEndpoint%2CSystem.ServiceModel.Channels.BindingParameterCollection%29> method to pass data at runtime to bindings to support custom behavior.
The endpoint.
The binding parameters that support modifying the bindings.
Adds a client error inspector to the specified service endpoint.
The service endpoint.
The client runtime.
Override this method to change the way errors that occur on the service are handled.
The service endpoint.
The endpoint dispatcher.

Implements the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.IEndpointBehavior.ApplyClientBehavior%28System.ServiceModel.Description.ServiceEndpoint%2CSystem.ServiceModel.Dispatcher.ClientRuntime%29> method to support modification or extension of the client across an endpoint.

As part of this method, <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.WebHttpBehavior.GetRequestClientFormatter%28System.ServiceModel.Description.OperationDescription%2CSystem.ServiceModel.Description.ServiceEndpoint%29> and <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.WebHttpBehavior.GetReplyClientFormatter%28System.ServiceModel.Description.OperationDescription%2CSystem.ServiceModel.Description.ServiceEndpoint%29> are called for each operation to determine the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Dispatcher.IClientMessageFormatter> to install.
The endpoint that exposes the contract.
The client to which the custom behavior is applied.

Implements the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.IEndpointBehavior.ApplyDispatchBehavior%28System.ServiceModel.Description.ServiceEndpoint%2CSystem.ServiceModel.Dispatcher.EndpointDispatcher%29> method to support modification or extension of the client across an endpoint.

As part of this method, <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.WebHttpBehavior.GetRequestDispatchFormatter%28System.ServiceModel.Description.OperationDescription%2CSystem.ServiceModel.Description.ServiceEndpoint%29> and <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.WebHttpBehavior.GetReplyDispatchFormatter%28System.ServiceModel.Description.OperationDescription%2CSystem.ServiceModel.Description.ServiceEndpoint%29> are called for each operation to determine the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Dispatcher.IDispatchMessageFormatter> to install.
The endpoint that exposes the contract.
The endpoint dispatcher to which the behavior is applied.
Gets or sets a value that determines if automatic format selection is enabled.
[!INCLUDE[crabout](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)] automatic format selection, see [WCF Web HTTP Formatting](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if automatic format selection is enabled; otherwise <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Gets and sets the default message body style.

If the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Web.WebGetAttribute> or <xref:System.ServiceModel.Web.WebInvokeAttribute> does not explicitly set the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Web.WebInvokeAttribute.BodyStyle%2A> property, the value of this property is used as the body style for the operation.
The default value is <xref:System.ServiceModel.Web.WebMessageBodyStyle>.
One of the values defined in the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Web.WebMessageBodyStyle"></xref> enumeration.
Gets and sets the default outgoing request format.

If the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Web.WebGetAttribute> or <xref:System.ServiceModel.Web.WebInvokeAttribute> does not explicitly set the `OutgoingRequestFormat` property, the value of this property is used as the request format for the operation.
The default value is <xref:System.ServiceModel.Web.WebMessageFormat>.
One of the values defined in the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Web.WebMessageFormat"></xref> enumeration.
Gets and sets the default outgoing response format.

If the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Web.WebGetAttribute> or <xref:System.ServiceModel.Web.WebInvokeAttribute> does not explicitly set the `OutgoingResponseFormat` property, the value of this property is used as the response format for the operation.
The default value is <xref:System.ServiceModel.Web.WebMessageFormat>.
One of the values defined in the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Web.WebMessageFormat"></xref> enumeration.
Gets or sets the flag that specifies whether a FaultException is generated when an internal server error (HTTP status code: 500) occurs.
Returns <xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the flag is enabled; otherwise returns <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Creates a new <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Dispatcher.WebHttpDispatchOperationSelector"></xref> object.

The <xref:System.ServiceModel.Dispatcher.WebHttpDispatchOperationSelector> maps calls to [!INCLUDE[indigo2](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)] service operations based on the Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) suffix and the HTTP method used.

This is an extensibility point that derived behaviors can use to supply their own implementation of <xref:System.ServiceModel.Dispatcher.WebHttpDispatchOperationSelector> that maps the incoming HTTP request to a service operation.
The endpoint that exposes the contract.
An instance of <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Dispatcher.WebHttpDispatchOperationSelector"></xref> that contains the operation selector for the specified endpoint.
Gets the query string converter.

This is an extensibility point that derived behaviors can use to supply their own implementation of <xref:System.ServiceModel.Dispatcher.QueryStringConverter> that can convert the service operation parameter types to and from the HTTP request URL's query string.
The service operation.
A <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Dispatcher.QueryStringConverter"></xref> instance.
Gets the reply formatter on the client for the specified endpoint and service operation.

This is an extensibility point that derived behaviors can use to supply their own implementation of <xref:System.ServiceModel.Dispatcher.IClientMessageFormatter> that is called to deserialize the response message into the out parameters/return value of the service operation.
The service operation.
The service endpoint.
An <xref:System.ServiceModel.Dispatcher.IClientMessageFormatter> reference to the reply formatter on the client for the specified operation and endpoint.
Gets the reply formatter on the service for the specified endpoint and service operation.

This is an extensibility point that derived behaviors can use to supply their own implementation of <xref:System.ServiceModel.Dispatcher.IDispatchMessageFormatter> that is called to convert the return value/out parameters of the service operation to a response message.
The service operation.
The service endpoint.
An <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Dispatcher.IDispatchMessageFormatter"></xref> reference to the reply formatter on the service for the specified operation and endpoint.
Gets the request formatter on the client for the specified service operation and endpoint.

This is an extensibility point that derived behaviors can use to supply their own implementation of <xref:System.ServiceModel.Dispatcher.IClientMessageFormatter> that is called to convert the input parameters of the service operation call to a request message.

Parameters specified in the <xref:System.UriTemplate> of the service operation must be serialized to the `To` URI of the request message and other parameters must be serialized to the body of the request message.
The service operation.
The service endpoint.
An <xref:System.ServiceModel.Dispatcher.IClientMessageFormatter> reference to the request formatter on the client for the specified operation and endpoint.
Gets the request formatter on the service for the given service operation and service endpoint.

This is an extensibility point that derived behaviors can use to supply their own implementation of <xref:System.ServiceModel.Dispatcher.IDispatchMessageFormatter> that is called to deserialize the input parameters of the service operation from the request message.

Parameters specified in the <xref:System.UriTemplate> of the service operation must be deserialized from the `To` URI of the request message and other parameters must be deserialized from the body of the request message.
The service operation.
The service endpoint.
An <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Dispatcher.IDispatchMessageFormatter"></xref> reference to the request formatter on the service for the specified operation and endpoint.
Gets or sets a value that determines if the [!INCLUDE[indigo2](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)] Help page is enabled.

[!INCLUDE[crabout](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)] the [!INCLUDE[indigo2](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)] REST Help page, see [WCF Web HTTP Service Help Page](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).

To enable the helpEnabled attribute in a configuration file: ``` <system.serviceModel> <behaviors> <endpointBehaviors> <behavior name="MyEndpointBehavior"> <webHttp helpEnabled="true" /> </behavior> </endpointBehaviors> </system.serviceModel> ``` To programmatically enable the HelpEnabled property: ``` WebHttpBehavior helpBehavior = new WebHttpBehavior(); helpBehavior.HelpEnabled = true; host.Description.Endpoints[0].Behaviors.Add(helpBehavior); ```

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the [!INCLUDE[indigo2](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)]Help page is enabled; otherwise <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Gets or sets the JavaScript callback parameter name.
The JavaScript callback parameter name.
Confirms that the endpoint meets the requirements for the Web programming model.
Verifies the following: - The endpoint is not `null`.
- The endpoint uses the HTTP or HTTPS schemes.
- The <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.MessageVersion> of the binding is set to <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.MessageVersion.None%2A>.
- The binding contains an <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.HttpTransportBindingElement> where <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.TransportBindingElement.ManualAddressing%2A> is set to `true`.
- The parameters specified in the <xref:System.UriTemplate> must be part of the operation.
- Operations that specify <xref:System.ServiceModel.Web.WebMessageBodyStyle> have, at most, one input parameter and can have no out parameters.
The service endpoint.
Ensures the binding is valid for use with the WCF Web Programming Model.
The service endpoint.
